content:
The Entrepreneurship Capstone course is designed to provide you with feedback and guidance on your business idea, including its scalability. You'll have several opportunities to receive feedback from instructors and peers throughout the course.

**Instructor Feedback:**

* **Office Hours:** Instructors will hold regular office hours, where you can discuss your business idea, ask questions, and receive feedback.
* **Assignment Feedback:** Instructors will provide feedback on your assignments, including your business plan, pitch deck, and financial projections.
* **Live Sessions:** Instructors will lead live sessions, where they'll provide guidance, answer questions, and offer feedback on your business ideas.

**Peer Feedback:**

* **Peer Review:** You'll participate in peer review sessions, where you'll receive feedback from your peers on your business plan, pitch deck, and other assignments.
* **Discussion Forums:** You'll have access to discussion forums, where you can share your business idea, ask questions, and receive feedback from peers.
* **Group Work:** You might have opportunities to work on group projects, where you'll collaborate with peers and receive feedback on your business idea.

**Scalability Feedback:**

When you receive feedback on your business idea, you can ask specific questions about scalability, such as:

* "Is my business model scalable?"
* "How can I increase revenue without sacrificing profitability?"
* "What are the key drivers of scalability in my industry?"
* "How can I overcome common scaling challenges in my industry?"

Instructors and peers can provide valuable insights and suggestions to help you address these questions and improve the scalability of your business idea.

**Tips for getting the most out of feedback:**

* **Be open-minded:** Be prepared to receive constructive criticism and use it to improve your business idea.
* **Ask specific questions:** Clearly articulate your concerns and questions about scalability to get targeted feedback.
* **Provide context:** Share relevant information about your business idea, industry, and target market to help instructors and peers provide more informed feedback.
* **Act on feedback:** Implement changes and adjustments based on the feedback you receive to continuously improve your business idea.

By leveraging the feedback opportunities in the Entrepreneurship Capstone course, you'll be able to refine your business idea, address scalability concerns, and develop a solid business plan that's ready to launch.
